result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Per Atty Petersen's office, matter has resolved and requests to cancel PSC and set PLEAS. JA advised DE on 10/19/22 that 10/20/22 hearing is cancelled and next hearing is 12/2/22 at 3:30 p.m.  gll

for plea/sentencing hearing and remove 10/20 hearing. Filed by Atty. Petersen. kma

Filed by Atty  Damrau. arc   e: Atty Petersen.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, R.B.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:23 PM Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Melissa M. Petersen in court for Amanda Jo Brannon. Defendant Amanda Jo Brannon in court. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. DE obtained Counsel. Bond arguments. Court orders bond. Enters NG plea. Waives speedy trial. Court sets SETC and PSC. Adjourned
Settlement conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
